image.altText: An image of Erin Patterson.

props.synopsis: Accused killer Erin Patterson faces more questions on the witness stand at her triple-murder trial. She's accused of killing three relatives by serving them a meal that contained death cap mushrooms. Follow the trial live.

title.children: Erin Patterson denies intentionally putting death cap mushrooms in meal

image.altText: A drone shot of waves in front of a clubhouse.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government spent more than $500,000 earlier this year on protective works that have already failed to stop erosion in a coastal community.

title.children: Gippsland residents fear erosion measures no match for rising tides

image.altText: Forestry in SA's south-east

props.synopsis: As Australia looks to meet housing construction targets, companies in SA and Victoria's Green Triangle are investing more heavily in softwood timber.

title.children: Housing demand drives forestry companies' shift from blue gum to pine

image.altText: Laharum and Minyip-Murtoa women football captains shake hands at the Murtoa Recreation Reserve

props.synopsis: As women take to the footy field in the Wimmera for the first time, clubs report that their membership and supporter bases have grown considerably.

title.children: Women's footy is a 'win-win' in the Wimmera with support only growing

image.altText: Pigs in a pen.

props.synopsis: About 270 people will lose their jobs and multiple communities will be impacted with the pending closure of a rural South Australian pork processing plant.

title.children: Pork abattoir closure rubs 'salt in injury' for drought-hit towns

image.altText: A golden coloured dog in the arms of a firefighter.

props.synopsis: Ted the Labrador is rescued unharmed from an 8-metre-deep mine shaft in Central Victoria, four days after escaping his backyard with labradoodle Penny.

title.children: Missing for four days, Labrador Ted turns up in a mine shaft

image.altText: Former police officer Denis Ryan

props.synopsis: Child abuse victims and friends pay tribute to former Victoria Police detective Denis Ryan, who died in Mildura on Tuesday. Mr Ryan was driven from the force after attempting to charge paedophile Catholic priest Monsignor John Day in 1972.

title.children: Child abuse survivors pay tribute after death of detective Denis Ryan

image.altText: Alex Mills and two other men sitting near each other talking and smiling.

props.synopsis: Alex Mills has battled with stereotypes of what a man should be for years. He's now shedding light on toxic masculinity in a bid to get more men to think about the type of man they want to be and stamp out certain behaviours.

title.children: It's taken Alex decades to feel comfortable with the kind of man he is

image.altText: A boy faces a teacher who is standing in front of a blackboard.

props.synopsis: From next term, students in Victoria could be suspended or expelled for misbehaviour outside of school or online. The rules currently only apply to behaviour on school grounds.

title.children: Victorian principals given greater powers to expel students

image.altText: Dry, cracked ground on a farm.

props.synopsis: There are multiple signs a boost in rainfall this winter and spring will alleviate the record drought currently crippling southern Australia.

title.children: Hope on the horizon — five reasons the drought will ease this year

image.altText: Prison officers

props.synopsis: Exclusive data obtained by 7.30 reveals the extent of lockdowns inside the maximum security Dame Phyllis Frost Centre, and it's leading to a disturbing spike in self-harm.

title.children: Lockdowns, no meals, beaten staff. Inside a prison system in crisis

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: A trial date and location have been confirmed for the man charged with the alleged murder of Ballarat mother Samantha Murphy.

title.children: Trial date set for Patrick Stephenson, accused of killing Samantha Murphy

image.altText: A suspension bridge surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: Police say a group of 20 youths set upon two teenage males in Shepparton who were hospitalised with suspected machete injuries.

title.children: Two teens suffer suspected machete wounds in fight with 20 youths

image.altText: CFA firefighting equipment hangs from hooks.

props.synopsis: Firefighting operations will be disrupted across regional Victoria as CFA union members take industrial action after six months of stalled pay talks.

title.children: CFA staff start work bans after failed pay negotiations

image.altText: Black and white dairy cows stand looking at the camera. The grass under them is brown

props.synopsis: "Farm exits" are predicted amid drought and floods as dairy companies announce their minimum farm gate milk prices for the next financial year.

title.children: Struggling dairy farmers disappointed with milk prices

image.altText: Close up of a phone with SpaceX connectivity

props.synopsis: An Australia-first service using satellites to deliver text messages anywhere in the country promises to provide service to those living in mobile black spots.

title.children: Direct-to-satellite text messaging service gets first Australian users

image.altText: A low angle pic of public housing towers in front of a blue sky

props.synopsis: New research shows demand for social housing has grown at the same time as the number of people helped into homes slowed around the country.

title.children: Report questions how Australia can tackle need for public housing stock

image.altText: A soccer ball on a grassy pitch in late afternoon light

props.synopsis: An A-League soccer player from Western United is among those charged by Victoria Police following an investigation into alleged cheating on bets involving the game.

title.children: A-League player among those charged as police allege betting corruption

image.altText: A small plaque on a wall which reads The Supreme Court of Victoria

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court jury has heard a triple-0 call and viewed images of human remains in the trial of three people accused of kidnapping and murdering 19-year-old Charlie Gander in 2022.

title.children: Triple-0 call played, CFA captain speaks in Christmas Eve murder trial

image.altText: A painted face with eyes closed and a red mark on the forehead.

props.synopsis: The 100kg sculpture, which depicts a naked man and woman, upset parishioners who believed it had an "occult element".

title.children: Elderly man, youths accused of stealing controversial sculpture from church

image.altText: People dressed in hi-vis orange holding signs.

props.synopsis: Melbourne market vendors reached a deal with the state authority after an eight-month stand-off over rent hikes.

title.children: Stallholders cut deal in bitter rent dispute at Melbourne market

image.altText: A rope swing hangs from a tree above a river.

props.synopsis: Authorities say farmers revegetating the banks of the Hopkins River are crucial to saving the key south-west Victorian catchment, which is grappling with the impacts of climate change, drought and intensive agriculture.

title.children: Farmers restore nature to help river smashed by agriculture and drought

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou

props.synopsis: He has chased his impossible dream across clubs and continents. Now, Ange Postecoglou has made it real by coaching Tottenham to glory in the Europa League.

title.children: Ange breaks his silence: 'There'll be more stories to tell'

image.altText: A group of football players wearing red and black armbands

props.synopsis: Football players across Victoria don red armbands in protest over the axing of the Office of Women in Sport and Recreation.

title.children: Red armbands worn across football fields in silent protest over cuts

image.altText: Yellow walls with paintings on it and a doorway through which a yellow circle on red wall sits behind suspended bright clothes.

props.synopsis: The over-representation of Indigenous people in Australia's jails is at the centre of a new and powerful art exhibition at Melbourne's Heide Museum of Modern Art. Its curator says it's a "call to action".

title.children: 'Hard-hitting' truth-telling exhibition presents brutal truths about Australia

image.altText: A dark-grey two-storey concrete ruin of a hotel is nothing but a shell

props.synopsis: Once thriving with mining, farming or railways, it all came to an end in these places. Such is the history of Australia's many ghost towns.

title.children: Harsh economic realities doomed these ghost towns

image.altText: Liz Bonner at work 4

props.synopsis: Advocates claim that 'menopause-friendly' employers increase productivity and create a better culture, but only four Australian workplaces are officially accredited as menopause-friendly.

title.children: How to make workplaces more menopause-friendly

image.altText: A coach and three players stand on the podium with gold medals around their neck

props.synopsis: New Zealand centurion Casey Kopua received an SOS call from the Giants and was on a plane the next day. Coming out of retirement, it was the almost 40-year-old world champion's first elite netball game in six years.

title.children: Super Netball debut for 40-year-old 'fossil' sparks global headlines

image.altText: A police helicopter hovers above a cliff, with police winching a man up into the aircraft.

props.synopsis: Large waves crashed below as a police helicopter winched the man to safety after a rising tide left him stranded on a cliff face at Jan Juc, near Torquay.

title.children: Man winched to safety in Great Ocean Road cliff rescue

image.altText: Dark silhouettes walk through red smoke that rises from several spots on the road at night.

props.synopsis: Police say the assault happened during wild scenes ahead of last night's season decider between Melbourne City and Melbourne Victory.

title.children: Police officer assaulted before A-League grand final in Melbourne

image.altText: Picture of a little girl standing next to a pet sheep.

props.synopsis: Renters mark five years since Victorian legislation changed to allow tenants, including those in public housing, to keep pets with their landlord's permission.

title.children: Victorian tenants thrive five years after laws enable many to get a pet

image.altText: Andrew Bretherton sits in his wheelchair outside Windsor station in Melbourne's south-east.

props.synopsis: A disability advocate says he feels 'secluded' accessing Melbourne's train network, as the state government falls three years short of national targets to meet accessibility criteria.

title.children: Train pain for disability advocates using Melbourne's dated rail network

image.altText: A Geelong AFL forward puts his hands up for a double high-five with a teammate after kicking a goal.

props.synopsis: West Coast push Geelong, but Cats star forward Jeremy Cameron makes the difference with four final-quarter goals, after Kilda upset the Demons in Alice Springs. Follow live.

title.children: Geelong's Cameron finishes off the Eagles with goal-rush in Perth

image.altText: A small grey and brown possum is  being handled by scientists and is looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Two Leadbeater's possums settle into their new home in a program that has been more than a decade in the making.

title.children: Breeding hopes pinned on endangered possum pair
